qas.question: Which scientist was influenced by Marxism in the United Kingdom?
What did Marxist like Stuart Hall and Raymond Williams  they identify culture as?
What made up Leisure activities and goods as viewed by Marxist?

answers.text: art, music, film, food, sports, and clothing

qas.question: What led sociologist like Stuart and Raymond to focus on class relations and the organization of production?

answers.text: saw patterns of consumption and leisure

qas.question: Which scientist created Marxism in the United Kingdom?
What did Marxist like Stuart Hall and Raymond Williams discount culture as?

plausible_answers.text: they saw patterns of consumption and leisure as determined by relations of production

qas.question: What led sociologist like Stuart and Raymond to focus on individuals and the organization of destruction?

context: In the <b7_0>United Kingdom<b7_0/>, sociologists and other scholars influenced by Marxism, such as <a0_0><b4_0>Stuart Hall<b4_0/> (1932–2014) and Raymond Williams (1921–1988)<a0_0/>, developed cultural studies. Following nineteenth-century Romantics, they identified "culture" with <a1_0><b5_0>consumption goods and leisure activities<b5_0/><a1_0/> (such as <a2_0>art, music, film, food, sports, and clothing<a2_0/>). Nevertheless, <b6_0>they <a3_0>saw patterns of consumption and leisure<a3_0/> as determined by relations of production<b6_0/>, which led them to focus on class relations and the organization of production.
